steps.title: Sketch a circle and an oval for Bugs Bunny's head.
steps.content: Sketch a circle and an oval for Bugs Bunny's head. Draw two long and pointy ovals above the head for the ears, and another if you want him to appear sad.

steps.title: Draw the line of action.
steps.content: Draw the line of action. Draw a small oval for the neck and an overlapping circle and oval for the body. These shapes are technically round, but Bugs Bunny is fairly wiry, so make them vertical and oblong as depicted here.

steps.title: For each arm, draw two long, thin ovals.
steps.content: For each arm, draw two long, thin ovals. Add a circle for each of his hands.

steps.title: Connect ovals to each circle for the fingers.
steps.content: Connect ovals to each circle for the fingers. They should be a bit thicker than you’d expect, because Bugs wears gloves that cover up his fingers (you’ll add on that part later).

steps.title: For the legs, draw a rectangle for each leg.
steps.content: For the legs, draw a rectangle for each leg. Draw an oblong oval for the feet.

steps.title: Draw three ovals on each foot for the toes.
steps.content: Draw three ovals on each foot for the toes. (This step can be difficult to get right, but they don’t have to be perfect, and you can always go back and try to fix them.)

steps.title: Re-focus on the face.
steps.content: Re-focus on the face. Draw an upside-down triangle in the middle of the oval for the nose, and a curvy "w" for the mouth with a small line at each corner, so it looks like a smirk. Under that, draw a square with a half line in the middle for the teeth.

steps.title: Add in some whiskers and two ovals for the eyes.
steps.content: Add in some whiskers and two ovals for the eyes. Draw small circles for the pupils, and fill them in.

steps.title: Put in some more details, like color separations and gloves.
steps.content: Put in some more details, like color separations and gloves. The gloves should have indentations on them and end roundly around his wrists.

steps.title: Erase the guidelines.
steps.content: Erase the guidelines. Then outline your drawing more darkly with a pen or a marker .

steps.title: Color Bugs in and you're finished!
steps.content: Color Bugs in and you're finished! The traditional Bugs Bunny is mostly gray and white, but you can use whatever colors you’d like for your drawing.

steps.title: start of with a pencil.
steps.content: start of with a pencil. Draw two simple ovals, as shown.

steps.title: Add two more ovals for the ears.
steps.content: Add two more ovals for the ears.

steps.title: Now, add rectangles, for legs and one for the arm.
steps.content: Now, add rectangles, for legs and one for the arm.

steps.title: Again, more ovals, for the feet and cheeks.
steps.content: Again, more ovals, for the feet and cheeks.

steps.title: Draw more lines, add more details…for fingers and legs.
steps.content: Draw more lines, add more details…for fingers and legs.

steps.title: Now, draw his eyes, fingers and other parts.
steps.content: Now, draw his eyes, fingers and other parts.

steps.title: Erase everything which is not needed anymore and shape the drawing.
steps.content: Erase everything which is not needed anymore and shape the drawing.

steps.title: Outline the drawing, with pencil or felt pen.
steps.content: Outline the drawing, with pencil or felt pen.

steps.title: Color the drawing using crayons markers and colored pencils .using only gray color, and little bit of pink for is tiny muzzle
steps.content: Color the drawing using crayons markers and colored pencils .using only gray color, and little bit of pink for is tiny muzzle
